commitResults.messageTitle: Level 1: customised chatbot name, display; added greeting, echo, exit
Level 2: added ability to store and display items
Level 3: added ability to mark tasks as done or undone
Level 4: added support for tracking ToDos, Events, Deadlines
Inform user when task list is empty
Resolved formatting issue; deleted logo to pass testing
Level 6: added support for deleting tasks
Added back CaCa logo, able to pass test with "diff -w" instead of "diff
Added reference for CaCa logo as a comment
Created individual functions for greeting, bye, listTasks, markTask and unmarkTask to tidy up code in main

commitResults.messageBody: Edit JavaDoc for isValid method.
Add CaCa introduction and features

commitResults.messageTitle: Add author and version for all classes
commitResults.messageBody: Edit JavaDoc of all classes according to requirements by adding author and version
Add features with detailed description
Change constants to caps
Improve code quality by declaring variables and use variable name when possible.
Improve code quality by changing todo, deadline and event into methods to be used in main.

commitResults.messageTitle: Declare variables as final, add JavaDoc
commitResults.messageBody: Declare LINE and array tasks as final. Add previously missing JavaDoc for @throws. Renamed some variable for a better name.
Improve code quality by converting delete into a method to be used in main.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add finally statement for try-catch block
Edit style to follow coding standard

commitResults.messageBody: Add else statement for if-else block; add JavaDoc for isValid; improve code readability

commitResults.messageTitle: Level 7: save tasks in hard disk
commitResults.messageBody:
Tasks entered by user is not stored in memory.

Storing task inputs could allow users to review and return to
the previous task list created more conveniently without the need
to add all the tasks again.

Let's,
* create a Storage class to save the tasks in hard disk
automatically whenever the task list changes
* load data whenever CaCa program runs.

commitResults.messageTitle: Level 8: create date and time in correct format
commitResults.messageBody:
Dates and times for deadline and event are treated as strings by CaCa.

CaCa should understand dates and times in the correct format
so that date/time inputs are more meaningful.

Let's,
* teach CaCa how to understand dates and times by storing them
as LocalDateTime
* allow date and time inputs in the format dd/MM/yyyy HHmm
* print date and time in the format MMM dd yyyy HH:mm

The test files input.txt and EXPECTED.TXT do not contain
test inputs to test functions implemented in Level 8 (Dates and Times).

Tests should be included to test the behaviour of program
for Level-8 and also in future modifications.

Let's update input.txt and EXPECTED.TXT to include those tests.

Some classes and main program contain long blocks of code and logics.

Code could be refactored to extract out closely related code
as classes.

Let's extract the classes below
* Ui.java, which handles interactions with user
* Storage.java, which handles loading and saving tasks in local file
* Parser.java, which handles user command with logics
* TaskList.java, which contains operations to modify task list

All classes are not divided into packages.

Classes should be organised into packages for easier management.

Let's divide classes into multiple packages.

There are no JUnit tests for automated testing.

JUnit is an important unit testing framework for testing projects
to ensure each class and method behaves correctly.

Let's add JUnit tests for some classes as automated unit testing.

Some JavaDoc comments are missing,
some are not in the correct format.

There is a need to provide clear documentation of the classes
and methods for both developer-as-user and developer-as-maintainer.

Let's add more JavaDoc comments and improve on existing ones.

Some blocks of code do not follow
the required coding standard closely.

Code should be neat and follows a consistent style
for better readability and code quality.

Let's tweak the code to comply more closely
with the given coding standard.

commitResults.messageTitle: Level-9: allow users to find a task with a keyword
commitResults.messageBody:
Tasks added into the list are hard to find manually,
especially if the list is long.

Allowing users to enter keywords to find a task will
improve CaCa functionalities and convenience.

Let's add a find operation that CaCa can perform.

There are no tests to verify the behaviour of findTask method.

This could lead to potential bugs not discovered.

Let's add inputs and expected outputs for findTask.

One can only check for style errors manually.

Adding CheckStyle which is a static analysis tool
can help to check Java code against style rules more easily.

Let's use CheckStyle plugin with Gradle
to check for style errors more conveniently.

commitResults.messageTitle: Level 10: add a GUI to project
commitResults.messageBody:
Project displays all output and interactions with user in terminal.

This is not aesthetically pleasing and could be improved with GUI.

Let's add a GUI to CaCa and use JavaFX technology to implement it.

README.md is not up-to-date with the most recent functions.

Updating README allows users to understand the project better 
and know how to download and run the program.

Let's ,
* update the user guide
* add in more information to promote CaCa.

README seems wordy 
especially ending off with long user guide.

Adding some images and emojis could attract 
more attention and interest of potential users.

Let's add CaCa and user images 
to introduce the application better.

Some assumptions are made in the code but not checked.

Java assertions can verify assumptions
about the program state at runtime.

Let's use assertions to the code.

Some methods do not follow OOP closely and may be hard to follow.

Refactoring could improve code structure and quality.

Let's refactor to improve the code quality
(mainly in Parser class and TaskList class) by
* consolidating duplicate conditional fragments
* extracting methods
* adding any corresponding tests for new behaviours or methods

The same task can be added multiple times to the task list.

The task list may contain many duplicate tasks
and will be hard to manage, i.e. mark, unmark and delete.

Let's
* edit the addTask method to detect duplicate tasks using stream.
* add tests to test simple duplicate tasks with no task type required.
More tests with task types, i.e. todo, deadline and event
will be added in later commits.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add tests to check duplicate method
commitResults.messageBody:
There are no unit tests to test the behaviour of new addTask method
with new function of checking duplicate tasks.

Some tests should be added to ensure that its behaviour
is consistent with what is expected. These tests can also be
used in future whenever there is a code change as a verification.

Let's add tests when duplicate todo, deadline
and event tasks are added.

GitHub prompts that some checks were not successful,
which are caused by checkstyle errors.

The errors should be fixed for successful build and check
with Gradle on GitHub as well as successful build
when checkstyle command is keyed in manually into terminal.

Let's fix checkstyle errors
to check if Gradle can build successfully now.

There is no prompt for the commands that user can enter.
The error messages also appear in the same style as other messages.

Adding buttons so that user guide is shown after clicking
could help to guide the user.
Highlighting errors with a different style
could catch user's attention.
These changes could improve UX.

Let's
* highlight error messages in a different format
* add user guide with quick start and detailed guide options

CaCa has a lovely personality but more can be done to show it.

Adding features like emojis can show CaCa's personality better
and make CaCa unique.

Let's add some emojis.

User could mark or unmark a task repeatedly without any warning
for tasks that are already marked or unmarked.

Warning messages could be displayed to improve this function
to prompt user about it.

Let's add warning messages when user wants to mark or unmark
tasks that have already been marked or unmarked previously.

commitResults.messageTitle: A-MoreTesting: add more automated JUnit tests
commitResults.messageBody:
There is no test to check the behaviours of the
newly modified mark and unmark task.

Adding some tests to check for its behaviour could ensure that
this function is working as intended.

Let's write tests for marking and unmarking a test.

There is in-app guidance of quick start or detailed guidance
when user presses the respective button, but there is no command
to the guidance if user prefers typing a command.

Other than clicking the buttons for guide,
a help command that leads to the guide could also help
users to navigate this program more easily.

Let's add a help command for users to access the detailed help page.

Help response from CaCa using help command has a different
interface as the detailed guide access through the button.
They are not consistent.

This might confuse the user. Since both leads to the same help
page, we could make them to have the same interface.

Let's align the guide interfaces.
